guidelinename: CYP2D6, CYP2C19 and Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors

citations.title: Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) Guideline for CYP2D6 and CYP2C19 Genotypes and Dosing of Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors

implications.CYP2D6: Reduced metabolism when compared to normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose
recommendations.comments: n/a

recommendations.drugrecommendation: No recommendation

implications.CYP2D6: Greatly reduced metabolism when compared to normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Select alternative drug not predominantly metabolized by CYP2D6 or if paroxetine use warranted, consider a 50% reduction of recommended starting dose and titrate to response.
recommendations.comments: Drug-drug interactions and other patient characteristics (e.g., age, renal function, liver function) should be considered when selecting an alternative therapy.

implications.CYP2D6: Increased metabolism to less active compounds when compared to normal metabolizers. Lower/undetectable plasma concentrations may increase probability of pharmacotherapy failure.

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Select alternative drug not predominantly metabolized by CYP2D6
recommendations.comments: Drug-drug interactions and other patient characteristics (e.g., age, renal function, liver function) should be considered when selecting an alternative therapy.
